title: Guru Offering Free Virtual Meditation to Help Ease Your Mind
author: Charlotte
description: Charlotte Meditation is holding free Facebook live sessions.
cleaned_text: CHARLOTTE, N.C. -- "Close your eyes and relax." That is how Guru Ranjit Deora began his Facebook live meditation Monday morning. Guru Ranjit Deora is the founder of Charlotte Meditation. He has practiced meditation for 40 years and taught it for 25 years. He is holding public Facebook live meditations every Monday. "Meditation is the relaxation of your mind, body and spirit," Deora said. RELATED ITEMS [Coronavirus? Allergies? The flu? Check your symptoms](https://spectrumlocalnews.com/coronavirus) [Here's How Our State is Responding to the Pandemic](https://www.ncdhhs.gov/divisions/public-health/coronavirus-disease-2019-covid-19-response-north-carolina) - MORE: The uncertainty and instability caused by the coronavirus can cause anxiety. that is why, he says, meditation is particularly important during this time. "We want answers and when we do not have answers, our mind and body is overworked," Deora said. "We are fighting; physically, emotionally, we are fighting." [A peer-reviewed study](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/pmc4940234/) published in the U.S. National Library of Medicine shows meditation could help improve a person's immune system by producing more antibodies. [Other studies](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/7649463) have shown it can reduce stress. Deora said when people don't take care of their mind, there can be a ripple effect. "When your mind is busy, your mind is stressed and you can't sleep," Deora said. "When you cannot sleep, a lack of sleep gives you anger. So we are fighting more." For those who have scattered brains or trouble staying focused while meditating, Deora suggests starting with breathing exercises. "Take a deep breath and hold," Deora said. "Now breathe out." Deora said meditation can be done just about anywhere. For example, a car, bathroom, or any space where a person can tune out noise. The next Facebook Live meditation will be Monday at 10 a.m. [Click here](https://www.facebook.com/gururanjit.deora.3) to tune in.
